segments.text: I notice the boy balancing on that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so focused on the jar, like nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, her hand outstretched like she’s begging.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely unaware, just drying dishes like it’s any other day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she doesn’t even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting slippery, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy will fall before the woman notices anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious everyone is to the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is going to tip, and it’s going to be a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope no one gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
